content.question: Let <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the region in the first quadrant bounded by the <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>- and <math alttext="y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axes, the horizontal line <math alttext="y equals 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the graph of <math alttext="y equals, the natural log of x" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></math>, as shown in the figure above. What is the volume of the solid generated when region <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is revolved about the <math alttext="y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis?

choices.label: <math alttext="pi, times, open parenthesis, e minus 1, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>π</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>e</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator pi, times, open parenthesis, e squared, minus 1, close parenthesis, and denominator 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="pi, times, open parenthesis, e squared, minus 1, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>π</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2 pi, times, open parenthesis, e squared, minus 1, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator pi, times, open parenthesis, e squared, minus 1, close parenthesis, and denominator 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 8.9: Volume with Disc Method - Revolving Around the x- or y-Axis

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
